Node.gloss: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon|to bring upon|to impose upon|to charge with|to commit to
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities hold (other) humans responsible for an event that has taken place or that is to take place in the future
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man, probably to be identified with Xerxes; ◄ son of Darius (דָּרְיָוֶשׁ) I; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) husband of Vashti (וַשְׁתִּי) and Esther (אֶסְתֵּר)
= an amount of money that is to be paid to a foreign ruler as a sign of dependence

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= state in which humans have power and authority
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= exact and detailed information about something
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative process by which humans or deities cause humans to increase in status, as a result of their authority, wealth, or wisdom
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

Node.gloss: the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Media and Persia
Node.definition: = a book containing the events of the reigns of the kings of Media and Persia
literally: words of days; hence: = a written record of events
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by Madai; the empire was consolidated in the 6th 5th and stretched from Mesopotamia to Turkey
= a nation and its territory, which was greatly expanded during the reign of Cyrus (כֹּורֶשׁ) I.

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man, probably to be identified with Xerxes; ◄ son of Darius (דָּרְיָוֶשׁ) I; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) husband of Vashti (וַשְׁתִּי) and Esther (אֶסְתֵּר)
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group
= causative action by which humans make an effort to ensure that a certain event takes place
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= group of people that consider themselves descendants of one single ancestor
